meta.purpose: Standup script for Synesthetic Labs v2 - minimal schema-driven architecture
meta.schema_lock: This standup is confined to schema version 0.7.3 - do not mix versions

context.core_problem: v0.3.6a failed to achieve MCP validation due to: schema authority confusion, hardcoded template generators, premature abstraction, and tests validating against wrong schemas
context.key_insight: MCP is the ONLY schema authority. Generators must be schema-driven, not template-based. Prove minimal implementation before adding features.

principles: MCP is single source of truth for schemas - never cache to disk
Schema-driven generation - read structure from MCP, don't hardcode templates
Test-first development - prove MCP validation passes before adding features
Minimal core first - single generator, single test, then extend
No normalization layers - generators output correct structure initially
Inline schema resolution by default - required for strict validation
One schema version per standup - version 0.7.3 locked for this environment
Self-contained labs - templated structure, environment isolated per schema version

standup_steps.description: Extract and preserve the components that work from v0.3.6a

actions.rationale: MCP client is solid - fetches schemas correctly, validates strictly
Early environment configuration prevents downstream issues

standup_steps.description: Create clean v2 directory structure with minimal dependencies - templated and self-contained

environment.isolation: All schema-specific code lives in versioned namespace
environment.template: Repeatable standup pattern for future schema versions

standup_steps.description: Build single schema-driven generator that reads from MCP - confined to 0.7.3

algorithm: 1. Fetch schema from MCP via load_schema_bundle(client=mcp_client, version='0.7.3')
4. For each required field, determine structure from schema:
- Handle anyOf by picking first valid option
- Read nested required fields from selected anyOf option
- Build structure matching schema, not hardcoded templates
5. Return asset dict with correct structure
key_points: NO assumptions about field names (read from schema)
For anyOf/oneOf: pick first option, extract its required fields
Example: shader anyOf[0] requires fragment_shader, name, vertex_shader (NOT sources object)

standup_steps.description: Create THE test - single test that proves MCP validation for 0.7.3

steps: 6. assert result['valid'] is True, f"MCP validation failed: {result.get('errors', [])}"
implementation.success_criteria: Test passes with strict=True MCP validation
implementation.rationale: This test failing means core doesn't work. Nothing else matters until this passes.

standup_steps.description: TDD loop until validation test passes
process: 2. Test fails with MCP validation errors
3. Examine error: which field is wrong? missing? wrong type?
4. Fix labs/v0_7_3/generator.py to read that field from schema correctly
7. DO NOT add features - only fix to match 0.7.3 schema
debugging_tips: Compare: does asset structure match schema required fields?
Check anyOf: did we pick the right option? read its required fields?
Validate incrementally: start with top-level required, then nested

standup_steps.description: Confirm minimal implementation passes all criteria

checklist.verification: Code calls load_schema_bundle(client=...) - no disk file reads
Field names match schema properties (e.g., vertex_shader not sources.fragment)
meta/schemas/ directory doesn't exist or is documented as non-authoritative

standup_steps.description: Only after minimal works, add features one at a time

phases.name: external_llm_content
phases.description: Add Azure/Gemini for rich content generation
phases.approach: Use LLM to generate shader code, descriptions, BUT still use schema-driven structure assembly
phases.rationale: LLM generates content (code), schema drives structure (field names/nesting)

phases.name: multi_component
phases.approach: Extend generator to read all component schemas, build each from schema

phases.name: advanced_features
phases.requirement: Only add after phases 2.1-2.3 all pass MCP validation

do_not.why: Docs don't fix architecture - users called it 'cruft'
do_not.instead: Fix code first, document working system

do_not.why: Creates divergence - stubs don't match MCP reality
do_not.instead: Fetch from MCP every time, cache in memory if needed

do_not.pattern: Add normalization to fix generator output
do_not.why: Normalization is a band-aid for wrong generators
do_not.instead: Make generators output correct structure initially

do_not.pattern: Support multiple schema versions before one works
do_not.instead: Support ONE version (0.7.3), upgrade when ready

do_not.pattern: Add features before core validation passes
do_not.why: Building on unvalidated foundation - entire system fails

schema_version_isolation.principle: Each schema version gets its own namespace to prevent version mixing
structure: meta/schemas/0.7.3/ - Cached reference (MCP is still authority)
benefits: Clear separation - no version mixing bugs
Can support multiple versions side-by-side if needed
Easy to upgrade - create new namespace for next version
Testable - each version has its own test suite
Self-contained - all 0.7.3 code in one place
schema_version_isolation.upgrade_path: To support 0.7.4: Create labs/v0_7_4/, tests/v0_7_4/, follow same pattern

standup_execution: 2. Execute steps 1-2: Copy working code, create minimal structure
5. Execute step 5: TDD loop until test passes
6. Execute step 6: Verify all criteria met
8. Only then: Execute step 7 - extend incrementally
development_loop: 1. Write test that uses MCP validation for 0.7.3
2. Implement feature in labs/v0_7_3/ reading from schema
3. Run test - if fails, examine MCP errors
